mdRecord.dcterms:title: Corsham Court Bath House, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Brown, Capability (English landscape architect, 1716-1783) [work]
Nash, John (English architect and town planner, 1752-1835) [remodeling]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Of the three architectural works designed by Brown for the gardens, it is only the Bath House that stands testimony to his commission. It was later re-modelled by Nash, who added further gothic adornment to the picturesque building. The cold bath is sunk into the arcaded ground floor and a flight of steps leads to a dressing room above. The ogee shaped side archways, the windows, the gothic niches and the pinnacles of the roof remain from Brown's original pavilion. -- http://www.corsham-court.co.uk/Gardens/Commentary.html [work]
